metadata.title: CVE-2022-32545 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in ImageMagick, causing an outside the range ofrepresentable values of type 'unsigned char' at coders/psd.c, when craftedor untrusted input is processed. This leads to a negative impact toapplication availability or other problems related to undefined behavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4').
